meanings.sent1: The asphyxial environment made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified the asphyxial conditions in the room.
meanings.sent3: The asphyxial situation at the crowded concert was a real breath-taker.
meanings.sent4: The asphyxial grip of fear tightened around her heart.
meanings.sent5: The asphyxial fog enveloped the entire forest, making navigation impossible.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the process of asphyxiation.
meanings.sent1: The asphyxial symptoms were evident in the patient.
meanings.sent2: The investigation focused on the asphyxial factors in the case.
meanings.sent3: The asphyxial challenge of holding your breath underwater was intense.
meanings.sent4: The asphyxial silence in the room was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The asphyxial grip of anxiety made it hard to think clearly.

meanings.definition: Resulting from or characterized by asphyxia.
meanings.sent1: The asphyxial marks on the body indicated a struggle.
meanings.sent2: The asphyxial nature of the accident was clear from the evidence.
meanings.sent3: The asphyxial outcome of the experiment was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The asphyxial tension in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The asphyxial grip of winter froze the landscape in its icy hold.
